meanings.definition: Capable of undergoing frequent and rapid changes in genetic material.
meanings.sent1: The hypermutable virus quickly adapted to the new environment.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study hypermutable organisms to understand genetic variability.
meanings.sent3: The hypermutable bacteria decided to throw a party and invite all its genes.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas were as hypermutable as a chameleon changing colors.
meanings.sent5: The hypermutable nature of the gene made it difficult to predict its behavior.

meanings.definition: Subject to high rates of mutation.
meanings.sent1: The hypermutable cells showed unpredictable changes under the microscope.
meanings.sent2: The hypermutable population of insects evolved rapidly in response to environmental pressures.
meanings.sent3: The hypermutable DNA strand seemed to have a mind of its own, constantly switching things up.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were as hypermutable as a stormy sea, constantly shifting and changing.
meanings.sent5: The hypermutable genetic code resembled a constantly changing puzzle, challenging scientists to solve it.
